related_configuration:
<module name="TreeWalker">
        <module name="WhitespaceAround">
            <property name="allowEmptyConstructors" value="true"/>
            <property name="allowEmptyLambdas" value="true"/>
            <property name="allowEmptyMethods" value="true"/>
            <property name="allowEmptyTypes" value="true"/>
            <property name="allowEmptyLoops" value="true"/>
            <property name="allowEmptySwitchBlockStatements" value="true"/>
            <property name="ignoreEnhancedForColon" value="false"/>
            <property name="tokens"
                   value="LITERAL_CATCH, LITERAL_ELSE, LITERAL_FINALLY, LITERAL_WHILE"/>
        </module>
    </module>
explanation: The WhitespaceAround check only verifies the presence of some whitespace between a closing brace and a reserved word, such as 'else' or 'catch', but it does not enforce that it must be exactly one ASCII space. If a tab or multiple spaces are used, they are treated as valid, making the check incomplete.
